result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Lee Rucks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

to Court from DOC-Gabriel Gorske regarding sentence credit
Hearing set per BNB
Telephone conference on July 23, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew Lee Rucks in court with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Defendant Matthew Lee Rucks in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both counsel have received the revocation packet and are prepared to proceed today.
Atty Hendee states joint agreement.  Atty Murphy agrees.
BY THE COURT:
Cts 3 & 4:
Court sentences defendant to serve 4 years in the Wisconsin Prison System:  2 years Initial Confinement followed by 2 years ES, each count, concurrent to each other and concurrent to any other sentence.
Conditions as follows:
*Continue to pay restitution previously ordered
*Comply with any conditions recommended by the agent
*Pay outstanding costs
*Court orders that defendants court ordered financial obligations be paid at the rate of 25% of his prison wage and work release funds and any remaining balance be paid while on extended supervision

*Court grants 8 months jail credit on Ct 3 only
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 19, 2018 at 11:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 28, 2018 at 02:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 26, 2018 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court. Defendant Matthew Lee Rucks in court with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.   
Atty Murphy received the restitution document by Unity.   Court will call Mr. Tilleson.  Court calls and he is unavailable.  Court will proceed with the hearing.
Atty Murphy states what his objections are.

Court has received an itemized statement and questions Atty Murphy.  Atty Murphy makes arguments.
BY THE COURT:  Court orders Restitution amount of $15,043.34 to be added to Judgment.
Restitution Information
Letter to Court from Atty Tilleson regarding restitution hearing
Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)
Restitution hearing on February 2, 2017 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Matthew Lee Rucks in court with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 3 & 4.  Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Hendee states Restitution requests and states that the defendant has paid $6,423.73 to the COC office today and asks that the bond and restitution paid today be paid out to the victim.
Atty Murphy agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 3 & 4.  Counts 1 & 2 to be dismissed and read-in.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Court received and read the victim impact statement.
Atty Murphy makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 3 & 4:  Withhold Sentence; 30 months Probation with conditions:
8 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber on Ct. 3
  Report on or before January 20, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May serve in Rock County
Court Costs = $268.00 x 2 (on each count)
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge x 2 (on each count)
Restitution = $10,385.21 
bond to be applied and paid out to victim
  COC office to pay out Restitution to the victim
Counts 1 & 2 dismissed and read-in
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

Court takes the remainder of the Restitution under advisement and will set a restitution hearing.
  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 2, 2017 at 11:15 am.
